In particular, I'd recommend looking at Kris Zyp's columns, who seems to be trying hard to fight against this Bayeux nonsense (don't ask if you don't know ;) with more Web-friendly solutions:

http://cometdaily.com/2008/05/13/http-channels-2/



--- On Wed, 9/10/08, Nick Gall <nick.gall@...> wrote:


> Just as a set of HTTP/Javascript/DOM technologies and coding
> techniques got
> the name Ajax, there are a number of approaches for doing
> (pseudo) "push"
> with HTTP that go by the name "Comet". See
> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comet_(programming)
> for a good jumping off point. See also
> http://cometdaily.com/ . Contrary to
> popular opinion, some of these techniques have impressive
> degrees of
> scalability.
>
